description_txt: stated on November 30, 2009 in an interview on 'The Ed Show.':
quote_txt: "In the past year, more than 20 percent of Americans have changed their mind about the war in Afghanistan. They conclude we shouldn't be there."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2009 in the show 'Hardball With Chris Matthews':
quote_txt: "We're going to have more troops (in Afghanistan) . . . than the Russians had."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2009 in a speech at the United States Military Academy.:
quote_txt: "In the last few months alone, we have apprehended extremists within our borders who were sent here from the border region of Afghanistan and Pakistan to commit new acts of terror."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2009 in a statement on his show on Fox News Channel:
quote_txt: Less than 10 percent of Obama's Cabinet appointees "have any experience in the private sector."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2009 in a floor speech:
quote_txt: The Senate health care bill does not contain limits on medical malpractice lawsuits.

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2009 in a press release:
quote_txt: Under the Democratic health plan, families "will be forced to spend an additional $2,100 a year to keep their current health care."

description_txt: stated on November 23, 2009 in MSNBC's Countdown with Keith Olbermann:
quote_txt: A new Republican litmus test "would have resulted in (the GOP) kicking out Ronald Reagan."

description_txt: stated on November 20, 2009 in an interview on Telemundo:
quote_txt: On legalizing illegal immigrants.

description_txt: stated on November 29, 2009 in ABC's 'This Week with George Stephanopoulos':
quote_txt: "If you want to talk firsts for Bush, this was the first time in American history that a president took us into a war and cut taxes."

description_txt: stated on November 24, 2009 in a widely circulated e-mail:
quote_txt: "The Congressional Budget Office -- supposedly non-partisan -- estimates that in just a few years the average cost to every family of four (from cap and trade) will be $6,800 per year."

description_txt: stated on November 20, 2009 in MSNBC's the 'Ed Show':
quote_txt: "Ninety-eight percent of the American people will not see their taxes go up" due to the House health care bill.

description_txt: stated on November 25, 2009 in his campaign Web site:
quote_txt: "I have never voted for a tax increase."

description_txt: stated on November 23, 2009 in a widely circulated e-mail:
quote_txt: A data-storing microchip "would be implanted in the majority of people who opt to become covered by the public health care option."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: "Although Democrats represent only 10 of Florida's 25 districts, their districts received 60 percent of the stimulus funds."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in a newsletter:
quote_txt: Recovery.gov listed congressional districts that "do not exist."

description_txt: stated on November 23, 2009 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: Under the cap-and-trade bill, homes would have to be retrofitted to meet energy and water efficiency standards before they could be sold.

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in the House GOP Web site:
quote_txt: Senate health care legislation will "levy a new 'abortion premium' fee on Americans in the government-run plan."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in a press release:
quote_txt: The Senate health care bill "would leave 24 million people without insurance coverage."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in an interview with Politico:
quote_txt: If you look at last year's presidential campaign, "you can't find a mention of public option."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in a news release:
quote_txt: The Senate health care bill is longer than Tolstoy's 'War and Peace.'

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in a widely circulated e-mail:
quote_txt: Obama "closed offshore tax safe havens."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2009 in a widely circulated e-mail:
quote_txt: Obama has "visited more countries and met with more world leaders than any president in his first six months in office."

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2009 in data on its Web site:
quote_txt: 52 jobs have been saved or created in Florida's 34th Congressional District.

description_txt: stated on November 12, 2009 in the 'Rachel Maddow Show':
quote_txt: A small business receiving a federal tax credit "to provide health care for its employees ... would be barred under the Stupak Amendment from allowing their employees to use ... the health care that they offer them for abortion."

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2009 in MSNBC's 'Morning Meeting With Dylan Ratigan':
quote_txt: In the House health care bill, "Something like 2 percent of the people would [be] eligible even to get the public option."

description_txt: stated on November 18, 2009 in a television ad:
quote_txt: The United States has a supply of "more than 100 years of natural gas."

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2009 in her book, Going Rogue:
quote_txt: "Ronald Reagan faced an even worse recession" than the current one.

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2009 in her book, 'Going Rogue':
quote_txt: The McCain campaign "did not elaborate" on Obama's ties to ACORN.

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2009 in her book "Going Rogue":
quote_txt: A cap-and-trade plan promoted by Barack Obama would hit hardest "those already struggling to make ends meet."

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2009 in her book "Going Rogue":
quote_txt: Obama has admitted a cap and trade plan would cause electricity bills to "skyrocket."
